Then there was music and wonderful roses
 They tell me in sweet fragrant meadows
 Of dawn and dew
The bridge describes how the protagonist sees the world after he fell in love with another person. Now he truly sees and hears the wonders of mother nature.

There were birds in the sky
 But I never saw them winging
 No, I never saw them at all
 Till there was you

Just like the first verse, the second verse shows how you only start to realize these beautiful things like birds singing when you meet someone you truly love. It shows the depth of someone’s feelings when they´re in love.

There were bells on a hill
 But I never heard them ringing
 No, I never heard them at all
 Till there was you
In these first lines, the protagonist explains that he knew there were bells on a hill but hat he never heard them ringing, till love hit him and he started to truly appreciate and hear them.
